intro: Neriandra hancorniifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed neriandra, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features glossy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. Neriandra hancorniifolia is often found in heathlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
